TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IDockProvider

Docs.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support UI Automation client access to controls that expose their dock properties within a docking container.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Implemented on a UI Automation provider that must support the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.DockPattern> control pattern.
A docking container is a control that allows the arrangement of child elements, both horizontally and vertically, relative to the boundaries of the docking container and other elements within the container.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IDockProvider> does not expose any properties of the docking container or any properties of controls that may be docked adjacent to the current control within the docking container.
Controls are docked relative to each other based on their current z-order; the higher their z-order placement the further they are placed from the specified edge of the docking container.

Docs.summary: Gets the current of the control within a docking container.
Docs.value: The of the control, relative to the boundaries of the docking container and other elements within the container.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A docking container is a control that allows the arrangement of child elements, both horizontally and vertically, relative to the boundaries of the docking container and other elements within the container.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetDockPosition(valuetype System.Windows.Automation.DockPosition dockPosition) cil managed

Docs.param: The dock position, relative to the boundaries of the docking container and other elements within the container.
Docs.summary: Docks the control within a docking container.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A docking container is a control that allows the arrangement of child elements, both horizontally and vertically, relative to the boundaries of the docking container and other elements within the container.
